description:
Frustrating, insufficient, and irritating is how most citizens would describe civil servants. However, three new employees are about to discover what really happens behind the scenes. Lucy Yamagami, bent on revenge against the civil servant who allowed her comically long name to be put on her birth certificate; Yutaka Hasebe, an easygoing guy always on the lookout for a place to slack off; and Saya Miyoshi, a nervous first-time worker, are about to experience the underwhelming satisfaction of being government employees.

They are supposed to be trained by Taishi Ichimiya, but he has no idea how to do so, even though he has worked there for eight years. With an incompetent senior colleague and unfavorable confrontations with clients, the trio starts to lose faith in their chosen occupation but encourage each other to do their best.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Office Lady
tags.description: Prominently features a female office worker or OL.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Office
tags.description: Features people who work in a business office.

alternative: Lucy Kimiko Akie Airi Shiori Rinne Yoshiho Ayano Tomika Chitose Sanae Mikiko Ichika

node.description:
__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Profile](http://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=68) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mai__nakahara) | [Wiki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mai_Nakahara)

A voice actress and singer.

**Non-Anime Roles:**
• Seele Vollerei - Honkai Impact 3rd, Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
• Kaavi - Mahjong Soul (VG)
• Hiyori Tsuchinaga - Blue Archive (VG) 
• Cantarella - Wuthering Waves (VG)

__Height:__ 169 cm

[Website](http://www.toyosakiaki.com/) | [Profile](http://musicrayn.com/toyosaki_aki) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/toyosakiaki-blog/) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/23897.html) | [Twitter](https://x.com/a_toyosaki_yoda) | [Bilibili](https://space.bilibili.com/48207005) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aki_Toyosaki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%B1%8A%E5%B4%8E%E6%84%9B%E7%94%9F)

A voice actress and singer affiliated with Music Ray'n. One of the members of [Sphere](https://anilist.co/staff/103636).

**Non-Anime Roles:**
• Navia - Genshin Impact (VG)
• Crown - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
[Website](http://www.gahako.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yokaibox)

**Height:** 153 cm (5'0)

__[Profile (Osawa)](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/kayanoai/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kayanoai_0913) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kayanoai_0913/) | [YouTube Channel Official Twitter](https://twitter.com/_kayanomi) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0D6qi-Gr5RW7hqOvTEKmAw)__

__Introduction:__
Ai Kayano is a Japanese voice actress and vocalist currently affiliated with Office Osawa.

__Biography:__
Kayano wanted to work in a job that would involve "healing people", leading to initially take up a course at a vocational school. She worked in the beauty industry and became interested in acting after having seen [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477/). While attending school, Kayano continued working in the industry and paid for her tuition.

Kayano began working at Pro-Fit in 2010, voicing two supporting characters in the original video animation [Princess Resurrection](https://anilist.co/anime/9159/). In 2011, she voiced [Meiko "Menma" Honma](https://anilist.co/character/40592/) in [Anohana](https://anilist.co/anime/9989/) and received the Best Rookie Actress award for said role at the 6th Seiyuu Awards. Kayano, [Haruka Tomatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/95890/) and [Saori Hayami](https://anilist.co/staff/95869/) performed the series' ending theme "Secret Base – Kimi ga Kureta Mono (10 years after Ver.)", a cover of a song originally sung by the band Zone.

She is often praised for her vocal range, having voiced a variety of characters such as [Mayaka Ibara](https://anilist.co/character/55137/), [Mashiro Shiina](https://anilist.co/character/61371/), [Darkness](https://anilist.co/character/89363/) and [Akari Kawamoto](https://anilist.co/character/24311/) for example, none of which one would connect to the same voice actress.

**Trivia:**
- Worked part-time at a coffee shop with [Chinatsu Akasaki](https://anilist.co/staff/107652/) before becoming a voice actress.
- She got around 100 suggestions for her nickname in the Anohana radio show, from which she herself picked out Kayanon.

Non-anime roles:
- Atago - Azur Lane
- Graf Zeppelin - Azur Lane
- Kaga - Azur Lane
- Renown - Azur Lane
- Y'shtola Rhul - Final Fantasy XIV

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yasukiti01)

__Hometown:__ Anjo, Aichi Prefecture, Japan

Yasutaka Yamamoto debuted as a storyboard maker and a producer with episode 34 of Idaten Jump (2005) after working as an assistant producer for My Melody (2005) He then worked as an assistant director for The Orphans of Simitra (2008), and debuted as a director with Valkyria Chronicles the following year. Since then, he has worked on many productions as a director, storyboard maker, and producer. Some of these titles include: Actually, I Am… (2015), Hinomaru Sumo (2018), and Nekopara (2020).

_Source: Crunchyroll Expo 2020_

[1st Twitter](https://twitter.com/NishiiTerumi) | [2nd Twitter](https://twitter.com/Nishiiterumi1) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/teruminishii.bsky.social) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRVXG5v77o6zvzBxb9NxffQ) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/terumi_nishii/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=17680136) | [Website](http://studio-meiris.com/)

Initially wanting to become a mangaka, it wasn't until while studying at Osaka Designers' College that Ishii thought about becoming an animator after having seen [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/), a show directed by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/). Shortly thereafter a re-telling movie for the series was announced and Nishii set her sights on being part of the production. After graduating she joined Studio Cockpit and managed to make her debut on the film as an in-betweener.

In 2011, she made her debut as a character designer on [Penguindrum](https://anilist.co/anime/10721/), another show of Ikuhara's.

[Website](https://monaca.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_jp)

__MONACA__ is a Japanese music production studio, which was established by the composer Keiichi Okabe in October 2004.

__Members__:
• [Keiichi Okabe](https://anilist.co/staff/121585/Keiichi-Okabe) (CEO)
• [Satoru Kousaki](https://anilist.co/staff/101555/Satoru-Kousaki)
• [Ryuuichi Takada](https://anilist.co/staff/109459/Ryuuichi-Takada)
• [Kakeru Ishihama](https://anilist.co/staff/150946/Kakeru-Ishihama)
• [Hidekazu Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/141852/Hidekazu-Tanaka)
• [Keiichi Hirokawa](https://anilist.co/staff/156490/Keiichi-Hirokawa)
• [Kuniyuki Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/154774/Kuniyuki-Takahashi)
• [Shuotarou Seo](https://anilist.co/staff/317330/Shoutarou-Seo)
• [Oliver Good](https://anilist.co/staff/317296)
• [Keita Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/229376/Keita-Inoue)

__Past Members__:
• [Yuri Mitsumi](https://anilist.co/staff/201236/Yuri-Misumi)
• [Keigo Hoashi](https://anilist.co/staff/111233/Keigo-Hoashi)
**Kento Shimoyama** is a scriptwriter.
__Hobbies:__ football
Affiliated with Studio Shaft and Aniplex.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Gshock99)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/codamasaori) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/codamasaori/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/HdkzTanaka)

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Kobe University (Faculty of Developmental Sciences, Department of Human Representation)

__Hidekazu Tanaka__ is a Japanese composer and arranger.

He left MONACA on July 31, 2021, and went independent. 

On October 24, 2022, he was arrested on suspicion of sexual assault of a teenage girl in Meguro, Tokyo in August of that year. On March 15, 2023, Tanaka admitted to obscenity charges which included saying obscene language to a 15-year-old girl, along with admitting to voyeurism at least dozens of times in the past 10 years.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/HdkzTanaka)

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Kobe University (Faculty of Developmental Sciences, Department of Human Representation)

__Hidekazu Tanaka__ is a Japanese composer and arranger.

He left MONACA on July 31, 2021, and went independent. 

On October 24, 2022, he was arrested on suspicion of sexual assault of a teenage girl in Meguro, Tokyo in August of that year. On March 15, 2023, Tanaka admitted to obscenity charges which included saying obscene language to a 15-year-old girl, along with admitting to voyeurism at least dozens of times in the past 10 years.

__[Blog (JP)](https://junkot.exblog.jp/)__

__Junko Tsuji__ is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger and chorus performer.

__[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/okabe)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_okabe)__

__Keiichi Okabe__ is a Japanese vocalist, composer and arranger, who is particularly known for composing soundtracks for game producers Square Enix and Bandai Namco, which include various soundtracks for the Nier, Drakengard, and Tekken series. He is also the founder and CEO of music and sound production studio, MONACA.

__[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/okabe)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_okabe)__

__Keiichi Okabe__ is a Japanese vocalist, composer and arranger, who is particularly known for composing soundtracks for game producers Square Enix and Bandai Namco, which include various soundtracks for the Nier, Drakengard, and Tekken series. He is also the founder and CEO of music and sound production studio, MONACA.

Initially wanting to become a mangaka, it wasn't until while studying at Osaka Designers' College that Ishii thought about becoming an animator after having seen [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/), a show directed by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/). Shortly thereafter a re-telling movie for the series was announced and Nishii set her sights on being part of the production. In 2011, she made her debut as a character designer on [Penguindrum](https://anilist.co/anime/10721/), another show of Ikuhara's.

The current director of Chura Sound.
Producer affiliated with Cloverworks.

streamingEpisodes.title: Episode 1 - Be Careful About How You Refer to Someone and Why
Episode 2 - Don't Panic, Make a Scene, or Throw Away Your Job
Episode 3 - Don't Neglect the Safety of You or Your Workplace
Episode 4 - Beware of Next Week's Unseen Danger
Episode 5 - Everyone Has Close Calls. Learn from Them and Keep the Workplace Healthy
Episode 6 - Examine Unexpected Problems and Hide-and-seek
Episode 7 - Self Prevention, There Are People Where You Can't See
Episode 8 - A Dangerous Sprout, Beware Tanaka's Grandson
Episode 9 - Do you have it? Mental Capacity and the Accumulation of Feelings
Episode 10 - It'll Be Good Later, at the Same Time Good Things can Cause Huge Regrets
Episode 11 - Beware: the Sweet Trap That Tries to Lure You In
Episode 12 - Wait a Moment, Being Accustomed and Being Unprepared Are Life Threatening
Episode 13 - Now We're Set, a Fun Workplace Leading to Tomorrow
